TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Handler extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: A Handler allows you to send and process Message and Runnable objects associated with a thread's MessageQueue.

remarks.para: A Handler allows you to send and process Message and Runnable objects associated with a thread's MessageQueue. Each Handler instance is associated with a single thread and that thread's message queue. When you create a new Handler it is bound to a Looper. It will deliver messages and runnables to that Looper's message queue and execute them on that Looper's thread.

There are two main uses for a Handler: (1) to schedule messages and runnables to be executed at some point in the future; and (2) to enqueue an action to be performed on a different thread than your own.

Scheduling messages is accomplished with the #post, #postAtTime(Runnable, long), #postDelayed, #sendEmptyMessage, #sendMessage, #sendMessageAtTime, and #sendMessageDelayed methods. The post versions allow you to enqueue Runnable objects to be called by the message queue when they are received; the sendMessage versions allow you to enqueue a Message object containing a bundle of data that will be processed by the Handler's #handleMessage method (requiring that you implement a subclass of Handler).

When posting or sending to a Handler, you can either allow the item to be processed as soon as the message queue is ready to do so, or specify a delay before it gets processed or absolute time for it to be processed. The latter two allow you to implement timeouts, ticks, and other timing-based behavior.

When a process is created for your application, its main thread is dedicated to running a message queue that takes care of managing the top-level application objects (activities, broadcast receivers, etc) and any windows they create. You can create your own threads, and communicate back with the main application thread through a Handler. This is done by calling the same post or sendMessage methods as before, but from your new thread. The given Runnable or Message will then be scheduled in the Handler's message queue and processed when appropriate.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public Handler ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Default constructor associates this handler with the Looper for the current thread.

remarks.para:
Default constructor associates this handler with the Looper for the current thread.
If this thread does not have a looper, this handler won't be able to receive messages so an exception is thrown.

This member is deprecated. Implicitly choosing a Looper during Handler construction can lead to bugs where operations are silently lost (if the Handler is not expecting new tasks and quits), crashes (if a handler is sometimes created on a thread without a Looper active), or race conditions, where the thread a handler is associated with is not what the author anticipated. Instead, use an java.util.concurrent.Executor or specify the Looper explicitly, using Looper#getMainLooper, {link android.view.View#getHandler}, or similar. If the implicit thread local behavior is required for compatibility, use new Handler(Looper.myLooper()) to make it clear to readers.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.OS.Handler CreateAsync (Android.OS.Looper looper);
.method public static hidebysig class Android.OS.Handler CreateAsync(class Android.OS.Looper looper) cil managed
static member CreateAsync : Android.OS.Looper -> Android.OS.Handler

Docs.param: the Looper that the new Handler should be bound to
Docs.summary: Create a new Handler whose posted messages and runnables are not subject to synchronization barriers such as display vsync.
Docs.returns: a new async Handler instance

remarks.para: Create a new Handler whose posted messages and runnables are not subject to synchronization barriers such as display vsync.
Messages sent to an async handler are guaranteed to be ordered with respect to one another, but not necessarily with respect to messages from other Handlers.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public Android.OS.Message ObtainMessage ();
.method public hidebysig instance class Android.OS.Message ObtainMessage() cil managed
member this.ObtainMessage : unit -> Android.OS.Message

Docs.summary: Returns a new android.os.Message Message from the global message pool.
Docs.returns: To be added.

remarks.para: Returns a new android.os.Message Message from the global message pool. More efficient than creating and allocating new instances. The retrieved message has its handler set to this instance (Message.target == this). If you don't want that facility, just call Message.obtain() instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public hidebysig instance bool Post(class Java.Lang.IRunnable r) cil managed
member this.Post : Java.Lang.IRunnable -> bool

Docs.param: The Runnable that will be executed.
Docs.summary: Causes the Runnable r to be added to the message queue.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the Runnable was successfully placed in to the message queue. Returns false on failure, usually because the looper processing the message queue is exiting.

remarks.para: Causes the Runnable r to be added to the message queue. The runnable will be run on the thread to which this handler is attached.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool PostAtFrontOfQueue (Java.Lang.IRunnable r);
.method public hidebysig instance bool PostAtFrontOfQueue(class Java.Lang.IRunnable r) cil managed
member this.PostAtFrontOfQueue : Java.Lang.IRunnable -> bool

Docs.param: The Runnable that will be executed.
Docs.summary: Posts a message to an object that implements Runnable.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the message was successfully placed in to the message queue. Returns false on failure, usually because the looper processing the message queue is exiting.

remarks.para: Posts a message to an object that implements Runnable. Causes the Runnable r to executed on the next iteration through the message queue. The runnable will be run on the thread to which this handler is attached. This method is only for use in very special circumstances -- it can easily starve the message queue, cause ordering problems, or have other unexpected side-effects.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool PostAtTime (Java.Lang.IRunnable r, long uptimeMillis);
.method public hidebysig instance bool PostAtTime(class Java.Lang.IRunnable r, int64 uptimeMillis) cil managed
member this.PostAtTime : Java.Lang.IRunnable * int64 -> bool

Docs.param: The Runnable that will be executed.
The absolute time at which the callback should run, using the android.os.SystemClock#uptimeMillis time-base.
Docs.summary: Causes the Runnable r to be added to the message queue, to be run at a specific time given by <var>uptimeMillis</var>.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the Runnable was successfully placed in to the message queue. Returns false on failure, usually because the looper processing the message queue is exiting. Note that a result of true does not mean the Runnable will be processed -- if the looper is quit before the delivery time of the message occurs then the message will be dropped.

remarks.para: Causes the Runnable r to be added to the message queue, to be run at a specific time given by uptimeMillis. The time-base is android.os.SystemClock#uptimeMillis. Time spent in deep sleep will add an additional delay to execution. The runnable will be run on the thread to which this handler is attached.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Remove any pending posts of messages with code 'what' that are in the message queue.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RemoveMessages (int what, Java.Lang.Object? object);
.method public hidebysig instance void RemoveMessages(int32 what, class Java.Lang.Object object) cil managed
member this.RemoveMessages : int * Java.Lang.Object -> unit

Docs.summary: Remove any pending posts of messages with code 'what' and whose obj is 'object' that are in the message queue.

remarks.para: Remove any pending posts of messages with code 'what' and whose obj is 'object' that are in the message queue. If <var>object</var> is null, all messages will be removed.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SendEmptyMessage (int what);
.method public hidebysig instance bool SendEmptyMessage(int32 what) cil managed
member this.SendEmptyMessage : int -> bool

Docs.summary: Sends a Message containing only the what value.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the message was successfully placed in to the message queue. Returns false on failure, usually because the looper processing the message queue is exiting.

remarks.para: Sends a Message containing only the what value.

Docs.summary: Sends a Message containing only the what value, to be delivered at a specific time.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the message was successfully placed in to the message queue. Returns false on failure, usually because the looper processing the message queue is exiting.

Docs.summary: Sends a Message containing only the what value, to be delivered after the specified amount of time elapses.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the message was successfully placed in to the message queue. Returns false on failure, usually because the looper processing the message queue is exiting.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SendMessage (Android.OS.Message msg);
.method public hidebysig instance bool SendMessage(class Android.OS.Message msg) cil managed
member this.SendMessage : Android.OS.Message -> bool

Docs.summary: Pushes a message onto the end of the message queue after all pending messages before the current time.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the message was successfully placed in to the message queue. Returns false on failure, usually because the looper processing the message queue is exiting.

remarks.para: Pushes a message onto the end of the message queue after all pending messages before the current time. It will be received in #handleMessage, in the thread attached to this handler.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SendMessageAtFrontOfQueue (Android.OS.Message msg);
.method public hidebysig instance bool SendMessageAtFrontOfQueue(class Android.OS.Message msg) cil managed
member this.SendMessageAtFrontOfQueue : Android.OS.Message -> bool

Docs.summary: Enqueue a message at the front of the message queue, to be processed on the next iteration of the message loop.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the message was successfully placed in to the message queue. Returns false on failure, usually because the looper processing the message queue is exiting.

remarks.para: Enqueue a message at the front of the message queue, to be processed on the next iteration of the message loop. You will receive it in #handleMessage, in the thread attached to this handler. This method is only for use in very special circumstances -- it can easily starve the message queue, cause ordering problems, or have other unexpected side-effects.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool SendMessageAtTime (Android.OS.Message msg, long uptimeMillis);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool SendMessageAtTime(class Android.OS.Message msg, int64 uptimeMillis) cil managed
abstract member SendMessageAtTime : Android.OS.Message * int64 -> bool override this.SendMessageAtTime : Android.OS.Message * int64 -> bool

Docs.param: The absolute time at which the message should be delivered, using the android.os.SystemClock#uptimeMillis time-base.
Docs.summary: Enqueue a message into the message queue after all pending messages before the absolute time (in milliseconds) <var>uptimeMillis</var>.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the message was successfully placed in to the message queue. Returns false on failure, usually because the looper processing the message queue is exiting. Note that a result of true does not mean the message will be processed -- if the looper is quit before the delivery time of the message occurs then the message will be dropped.

remarks.para: Enqueue a message into the message queue after all pending messages before the absolute time (in milliseconds) uptimeMillis. The time-base is android.os.SystemClock#uptimeMillis. Time spent in deep sleep will add an additional delay to execution. You will receive it in #handleMessage, in the thread attached to this handler.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SendMessageDelayed (Android.OS.Message msg, long delayMillis);
.method public hidebysig instance bool SendMessageDelayed(class Android.OS.Message msg, int64 delayMillis) cil managed
member this.SendMessageDelayed : Android.OS.Message * int64 -> bool

Docs.summary: Enqueue a message into the message queue after all pending messages before (current time + delayMillis).
Docs.returns: Returns true if the message was successfully placed in to the message queue. Returns false on failure, usually because the looper processing the message queue is exiting. Note that a result of true does not mean the message will be processed -- if the looper is quit before the delivery time of the message occurs then the message will be dropped.

remarks.para: Enqueue a message into the message queue after all pending messages before (current time + delayMillis). You will receive it in #handleMessage, in the thread attached to this handler.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
